1151: We assume:
1152: 
1153: **A1 (Confinement)**: The potential $U: \mathcal{X} \to \mathbb{R}$ satisfies:
1154: - $U(x) \to +\infty$ as $x \to \partial \mathcal{X}$ or $|x| \to \infty$
1155: - $\nabla^2 U(x) \ge \kappa_{\text{conf}} I_d$ for some $\kappa_{\text{conf}} > 0$ (strong convexity)
1156: 
1157: **A2 (Killing near boundaries)**: The killing rate $\kappa_{\text{kill}}: \mathcal{X} \to \mathbb{R}_+$ satisfies:
1158: - $\kappa_{\text{kill}}(x) = 0$ on a compact subset $K \subset \mathcal{X}$ (safe region)
1159: - $\kappa_{\text{kill}}(x) \ge \kappa_0 > 0$ near $\partial \mathcal{X}$ (strong killing near boundaries)
1160: - $\kappa_{\text{kill}} \in C^2(\mathcal{X})$ with bounded derivatives
